skills.name: workflow-manager
skills.description: Manage Python development workflows with quality gates and decisions. Use when defining quality standards, evaluating code against gates, making accept/iterate/escalate decisions, or overseeing module development. Enforces structured process over raw capability.

skills.name: workflow-reviewer
skills.description: Independently evaluate code quality and workflow compliance. Use when performing objective quality assessment, validating against quality gates, or providing recommendations for management decisions. Separates review from development for objectivity.

skills.name: python-development-workflow
skills.description: Orchestrate end-to-end Python development using the manager-doer pattern. Use when starting a new module or feature to understand the complete workflow from discovery through completion, including phases, quality gates, and decision frameworks.

skills.name: gitops-workflow
skills.description: Manage git operations including branching strategies, conventional commits, and pull request workflows. Use when creating feature branches, writing commits, creating PRs, or managing development history. Integrates with the manager-doer workflow.

skills.name: python-coding-standards

skills.name: python-testing-standards
skills.description: Write effective Python tests using pytest and best practices. Use when creating test suites, designing test scenarios, handling edge cases, or ensuring comprehensive code coverage. Covers test organization, fixtures, parametrization, and validation.

skills.name: python-layout
skills.description: Python project and module structure guidance. Consistent conventions for project structure, module organization, file naming, and code organization within files.
